intro: Echinocactus chionanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is a slow-growing cactus with a columnar stem that develops a spiny, segmented appearance as it matures. The plant produces showy, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its roots are adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in drought conditions. Echinocactus chionanthus is prized for its unique appearance and is often cultivated as a decorative plant in desert gardens.
